isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - INSTALL

note.para: When the bottom reverse idler gear assembly is installed, make sure the three (3) magnetic discs are securely in place on the case bottom. Use Eaton Adhesive #71210 or Loctite 277.
The upper reverse idler is positioned in the case during mainshaft installation.

step1.para: If the reverse gear assembly is disassembled, position the needle bearing and inner race into the reverse idler gear ( Figure 213).

figure.caption: Figure 213. Position Needle Bearing and Inner Race into Reverse Idler Gear

step1.para: Place the rear thrust washer on the idler shaft ( Figure 214).

figure.caption: Figure 214. Place Rear Thrust Washer on Idler Shaft

step1.para: Insert the idler shaft into the case bore, threaded end to the front. As the shaft passes through the case bore, position the reverse idler gear on the shaft, long hub to the front ( Figure 215). Insert the thrust washer between the reverse idler gear and the case support boss. Finish inserting the idler shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 215. Insert Idler Shaft into Case Bore

step1.para: Make sure the reverse idler shaft is seated in the support boss bore.
Install the washer and lock nut on the shaft front. Tighten the stop nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N·m) ( Figure 215and Figure 216).
Thread the pipe plug into the reverse idler shaft and tighten ( Figure 217).

figure.caption: Figure 217. Thread Pipe Plug into Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para: Use a bearing driver and maul to install the auxiliary countershaft front bearing outer race against the idler plate ( Figure 218).

figure.caption: Figure 218. Install Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing Outer Race
